com.smartnsoft.droid4me.app

Class ProgressHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.smartnsoft.droid4me.app.ProgressHandler

  • public abstract class ProgressHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides a way to handle progress in an application, while it is computed something and the end-user is prompted to wait until a task completion.
    Since:
    2010.07.10
    Author:
    Ã‰douard Mercier

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  ProgressHandler.ProgressExtra
      A structure which encapsulates extra completion and textual message information related to a progression event.

      protected abstract void dismiss(android.app.Activity activity, java.lang.Object progressExtra)

    • Method Detail

      • show

        protected abstract void show(android.app.Activity activity,
        java.lang.Object progressExtra)
        Should be implemented so as to indicate to the end-user that some operation is under progress.
        Parameters:
        activity - the activity that originated a progress event
        progressExtra - the free object that has been passed when declaring the progress event
        See Also:
        onProgress(Activity, boolean, Object)

      • dismiss

        protected abstract void dismiss(android.app.Activity activity,
           java.lang.Object progressExtra)
        Should be implemented so as to indicate to the end-user that no more operation is under progress.
        Parameters:
        activity - the activity that originated a progress event
        progressExtra - the free object that has been passed when declaring the progress event
        See Also:
        onProgress(Activity, boolean, Object)

      • onProgress

        public final void onProgress(android.app.Activity activity,
              boolean inProgress,
              java.lang.Object progressExtra)
        Should be invoked when a progress event occurs.

        If the provided activity is finishing, it does nothing.

        Caution: this method must be exclusively invoked from the GUI thread!

        Parameters:
        activity - the activity from which the progress event is triggered
        inProgress - whether the progression is on or off
        progressExtra - a free object that will be passed along, and which can deliver additional information about the progress. Typically, those extra data can be the progression level, a title, a text...

      • onProgress

        public final void onProgress(android.app.Activity activity,
              boolean isLoading,
              java.lang.Object progressExtra,
              boolean fromGuiThread)
        The same method as #onProgress(Activity, boolean) except that it can be invoked from a non-GUI thread. In that case, the fromGuiThread parameter must be set to {@code false}.
